meanings.definition: The quality or state of being impracticable.
meanings.sent1: The impracticability of climbing the mountain in a day was evident.
meanings.sent2: The team discussed the impracticability of finishing the project before the deadline.
meanings.sent3: The impracticability of fitting an elephant into a suitcase made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her dream of flying without wings was as likely as the impracticability of turning lead into gold.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used the concept of impracticability to explain why time travel is not possible.

meanings.definition: The condition of being impossible or difficult to carry out.
meanings.sent1: The impracticability of finding a needle in a haystack is well-known.
meanings.sent2: The team faced the impracticability of reaching the island without a boat.
meanings.sent3: The impracticability of sneezing with your eyes open is a funny thought.
meanings.sent4: His plan to build a house of cards showed the impracticability of the idea.
meanings.sent5: The concept of impracticability was illustrated by the task of counting all the grains of sand on a beach.
